We weren't able to support flow layout rendering for our JavaScript intensive web controls such as map, overview and page layout... This was coz we didn't know of a way to determine the position (offsetLeft and offsetTop) of the control on the page in flow layout and this was necessary for the Javascripts to work... However, last week I was able to find the solution: In case of flow layout I observed that the values of the positon attributes (offsetLeft and offsetTop) of an element were relative to its parent element (i.e. if the map was within a table’s and offset by 1 px from the cell; the mapImage.offsetLeft returned me a value of 1). This means that the absolute position of the map on the page should just be a simple sum of the offsets of the map image and of all its parent elements. With this in mind, I wrote this JS function to calculate the position of the map image on the page when it was in flow layout: function calcImagePosition(mapImageId) { var parent = document.getElementById(mapImageId); var imgLeft = 0, imgTop = 0; while(parent != null) { imgLeft += parent.offsetLeft; imgTop += parent.offsetTop; parent = parent.offsetParent; } alert(imgLeft + “, “ + imgTop); } I called this function on body load, and the values of imgLeft and imgTop calculated in this function were indeed the absolute left and top positions of the map image on the page.
